title: Qutb al-Din Aibak
summary: Qutb al-Din Aibak (Persian: قطب‌الدین ایبک‎), (1150 – 14 November 1210) was a general of the Ghurid king Muhammad Ghori. He was in charge of the Ghurid territories in northern India, and after Muhammad Ghori's death, he became the ruler of an independent kingdom that evolved into the Delhi Sultanate ruled by the Mamluk dynasty.
